intro: Sonchus asper subsp. glaucescens, commonly known as rough hawksbeard, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring upright stems covered with coarse, bristly hairs. The plant has deeply lobed, rough-textured leaves and produces yellow composite flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. It is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in waste areas. Its botanical characteristics make it a common weed in agricultural and natural settings.
